channel.title: Keyboard and Touch pad dont work
channel.description:
I installed ubuntu using wubi on my D drive as a dual boot because D had the most space on it. I haven't been on vista in 3 days and when i booted up in vista and tried to log on the keyboard didn't work, but my USB mouse did, then when i unplugged my mouse the touchpad didnt work. So now i need to buy a USB keyboard for my laptop just to do crap in vista, does anyone know how i could get them to work again? I cant even login.
Note: The keyboard and touch work fine on ubuntu.

item.title: Keyboard and Touch pad dont work
item.dc:creator: @chrisn2323 chrisn2323
item.description:
@chrisn2323 wrote:

repair installation of windows?

item.source: Keyboard and Touch pad dont work

item.title: Keyboard and Touch pad dont work
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Ubuntu partitioned my drives, and moved all my windows restore files from D: to X: and we didnt find that out until we formatted the drives. Right now we have vista back on it but some hardware drivers arent working. We found the drivers on the acer website but after installation they still didnt work.

Read full topic
item.source: Keyboard and Touch pad dont work

item.title: Keyboard and Touch pad dont work
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Why don’t you call Microsoft and ask them what to do? You did pay for it for their awesome support right? You messed up some drivers in vista sounds like.

item.title: Keyboard and Touch pad dont work
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

R.I.P RSC:

You can’t get in vista at all?

only with a usb keyboard to login. I can see the login screen but i cant type or use the touch pad, it will only work with external devices for some reason.
